action.primary: Sedates the Heart and settles tremors and palpitations

indications: Disorientation, insomnia, palpitations with anxiety or convulsions due to Heart Blood Deficiency or Liver Yang Rising

action.primary: Warms the Lungs and descends Qi

indications: Cough or wheezing due to Deficiency Cold of the Lungs
Used for wheezing with copious sputum

action.primary: Warms the Womb and warms and unblocks the Chong and Ren channels

indications: Excessive menstruation, uterine bleeding or infertility due to Cold from Deficiency of the Womb

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency Fire.
Contraindicated for those with severe Blood Dryness.

useCases: Palpitations with anxiety, disorientation and insomnia due to Heart Blood Deficiency with Liver Yang Rising.
Fright, pain and convulsions due to Phlegm-Heat in the Heart channel.
Rebellious Qi in the Lungs with cough and wheezing with copious sputum.
Infertility, irregular uterine bleeding and vaginal discharge due to Cold from Deficiency of the Womb and the Sea of Blood.
Uterine bleeding due to Cold in the Womb.

notes: This herb calms the Spirit and settles the mind while augmenting the Liver Blood in the Lower Jiao.
Traveling through the Chong and Ren Channels, it warms the Womb.
Calcined Fluorite Duan Zi Shi Ying is easier to pulverize, more easily warms the Lungs, descends Qi, dispels Cold and warms the womb. This form of the herb is rarely used.
